Topic: Math
Question: A company produces 420 units of a particular computer component every month, at a production cost to the company of $110 per component, and sells all of the components by the end of each month. What is the minimum selling price per component that will guarantee that the yearly profit (revenue from sales minus production costs) will be at least $626,400 ?
Choices:
  A: 226
  B: 230
  C: 240
  D: 260
  E: 280
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
No reflection information provided.

Thought:
The company produces 420 units of a particular computer component every month, so it produces 420 x 12 = 5040 units per year.
The production cost to the company of each component is $110, so the total production cost per year is 5040 x $110 = $554,400.
The yearly profit (revenue from sales minus production costs) should be at least $626,400, so the revenue from sales should be at least $626,400 + $554,400 = $1,180,800.
The minimum selling price per component that will guarantee that the yearly profit will be at least $626,400 is the selling price that will give the revenue of $1,180,800 when 5040 units are sold.
Let x be the minimum selling price per component.
Then, the revenue from sales is x x 5040 = 5040x.
To guarantee that the yearly profit will be at least $626,400, we need to have 5040x - $554,400 >= $626,400.
Solving for x, we get x >= ($626,400 + $554,400)/5040 = $240.
Action: Answer("C")
